identificationModule.briefTitle: An 8-week Study to Evaluate the Dose Response of AHU377 in Combination With Valsartan 320 mg in Patients With Mild-to-moderate Systolic Hypertension
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo and Active Controlled, Parallel Group Study to Evaluate the Dose Response of AHU377 in Combination With Valsartan 320 mg After 8 Week Treatment in Patients With Mild-to-moderate Systolic Hypertension

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate dose response of blood pressure lowering for 4 doses of AHU377, given once daily (50 mg, 100 mg, 200 mg and 400 mg) in combination with a fixed dose of valsartan (320 mg).

armGroups.label: VAL + AHU 400 mg
armGroups.description: Participants were started with AHU377 100 mg + valsartan 160 mg every day (qd) for 1 week, then were uptitrated to AHU377 200 mg + valsartan 320 mg qd for another week, and then were uptitrated to AHU377 400 mg + valsartan 320 mg for the remaining 6 weeks.

armGroups.label: VAL + AHU 200 mg
armGroups.description: Participants were started with AHU377 100 mg + valsartan 160 mg qd for 1 week and then were uptitrated to AHU377 200 mg + valsartan 320 mg qd for the remaining 7 weeks.

armGroups.label: VAL + AHU 100 mg
armGroups.description: Participants were started with AHU377 50 mg + valsartan 160 mg qd for 1 week and then were uptitrated to AHU377 100 mg + valsartan 320 mg for the remaining 7 weeks.

armGroups.label: VAL + AHU 50 mg
armGroups.description: Participants were started with AHU377 50 mg + valsartan 160 mg qd for 1 week and then were uptitrated to AHU377 50 mg + valartan 320 mg qd for the remaining 7 weeks.

armGroups.label: VAL 320 mg
armGroups.description: Participants were started with valsartan 160 mg qd for 1 week and then were uptitrated to valsartan 320 mg qd for the remaining 7 weeks.

armGroups.label: LCZ 400 mg
armGroups.description: Participants were started with LCZ696 200 mg qd for 1 week and then were uptitrated to LCZ696 400 mg qd for the remaining 7 weeks.

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Participants received matching placebo to LCZ696, AHU377 and valsartan for 8 weeks.

interventions.name: LCZ696
interventions.description: LCZ696 was supplied as tablets in blister cards in 100 mg strengths.

interventions.name: Valsartan
interventions.description: Valsartan was supplied as tablets in blister cards in 160 mg and 320 mg strengths.

interventions.name: AHU377
interventions.description: AHU377 was supplied in tablets in blister cards in 50 mg and 100 mg strengths.

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Placebo was supplied as tablets in blister cards.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure (msSBP)
primaryOutcomes.description: Sitting BP measurements were performed at trough (23-26 hours post-morning dose). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Diastolic Blood Pressure (msDBP)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Sitting BP measurements were performed at trough (23-26 hours post-morning dose). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean 24 Hour Ambulatory SBP (maSBP) and Mean 24 Hour Ambulatory DBP (maDBP)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Twenty four hour ABPM was performed twice duirng the study at baseline and week 8. The second ABPM assessment was performed only in participants who had successfully completed the ABPM assessment at baseline. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Daytime maSBP and maDBP
secondaryOutcomes.description: Twenty four hour ABPM was performed twice during the study at baseline and week 8. The second ABPM assessment was performed only in participants who had successfully completed the ABPM assessment at baseline. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Nighttime maSBP and maDBP
secondaryOutcomes.description: Twenty four hour ABPM was performed twice duirng the study at baseline and week 8. The second ABPM assessment was performed only in participants who had successfully completed the ABPM assessment at baseline. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Sitting Pulse Pressure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pulse rate measurements were performed. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Ambulatory Pulse Pressure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pulse rate measurements were performed. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in maSBP and maDBP in Dippers
secondaryOutcomes.description: Twenty four hour ABPM was performed twice during the study at baseline and week 8. The second ABPM assessment was performed only in participants who had successfully completed the ABPM assessment at baseline. Dippers were defined as participants who showed a decrease of at least 10% in maSBP during the night (10pm-6am) compared with the daytime level. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in maSBP and maDBP in Non-dippers
secondaryOutcomes.description: Twenty four hour ABPM was performed twice duirng the study at baseline and week 8. The second ABPM assessment was performed only in participants who had successfully completed the ABPM assessment at baseline. Dippers were defined as participants who showed a decrease of at least 10% in maSBP during the night (10pm-6am) compared with the daytime level. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in msSBP and msDBP in Participants < 65 Years of Age
secondaryOutcomes.description: Sitting BP measurements were performed at trough (23-26 hours post-morning dose). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in msSBP and msDBP in Participants >= 65 Years of Age
secondaryOutcomes.description: Sitting BP measurements were performed at trough (23-26 hours post-morning dose). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in maSBP and maDBP in Participants < 65 Years of Age
secondaryOutcomes.description: Twenty four hour ABPM was performed twice duirng the study at baseline and week 8. The second ABPM assessment was performed only in participants who had successfully completed the ABPM assessment at baseline. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in maSBP and maDBP in Participants >= 65 Years of Age
secondaryOutcomes.description: Twenty four hour ABPM was performed twice duirng the study at baseline and week 8. The second ABPM assessment was performed only in participants who had successfully completed the ABPM assessment at baseline. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved Blood Pressure Control and Blood Pressure Response
secondaryOutcomes.description: Sitting BP measurements were performed at trough (23-26 hours post-morning dose). Blood pressure control was defined as msSBP/MSDBP \< 140/90 mmHg. Blood pressure response in msSBP was defined as \<140 mmHg or a reduction \>= 20mmHg from baseline. Blood pressure response in msDBP was defined as \< 90 mmHg or a reduction \>= 10 mmHg from baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events, Serious Adverse Events and Death
secondaryOutcomes.description: Adverse event monitoring was conducted throughout the study.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Written informed consent must be obtained before any assessment is performed. Patients with mild-to-moderate systolic hypertension, untreated or currently taking antihypertensive therapy.
* Ability to communicate and comply with all study requirements and demonstrate good medication compliance (≥ 80% compliance rate) during the run-in period.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Severe hypertension
* History of angioedema, drug-related or otherwise, as reported by the patient.
* Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women.
* Women of child-bearing potential (WOCBP), UNLESS they are using adequate birth control methods.
* History or evidence of a secondary form of hypertension.
* Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: In the double blind period, participants were randomized in a 2:2:2:2:2:2:1 ratio to AHU377 400 mg + valsartan 320 mg, AHU377 200 mg + valsartan 320 mg, AHU377 100 mg + valsartan 320 mg, AHU377 50 mg + valsartan 320 mg,valsartan 320 mg, LCZ696 400 mg and placebo, respectively.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: This study consisted of a single-blind run-in period and a double-blind (DB) period. During the 3 to 4 week run-in, participants were assessed for randomization eligibility into the DB period. 910 participants randomized. 3 participants were mis-randomized and did not receive study treatment. Therefore, the participant flow shows 907 participants.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Mean Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure (msSBP)
outcomeMeasures.description: Sitting BP measurements were performed at trough (23-26 hours post-morning dose). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Only participants of the full analysuis set (FAS), who had measurements at both baseline and week 8, were included in the analysis. The FAS included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blind study medication.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in msSBP and msDBP in Participants >= 65 Years of Age
outcomeMeasures.description: Sitting BP measurements were performed at trough (23-26 hours post-morning dose). A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Only participants of the full analysuis set (FAS), who were \>= 65 years of age and had measurements at both baseline and week 8, were included in the analysis. The FAS included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blind study medication.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in maSBP and maDBP in Participants < 65 Years of Age
outcomeMeasures.description: Twenty four hour ABPM was performed twice duirng the study at baseline and week 8. The second ABPM assessment was performed only in participants who had successfully completed the ABPM assessment at baseline. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: A subset of randomized participants, who were leass than 65 years of age and had ABPM measurements at both baseline and week 8, were included in the analysis.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Achieved Blood Pressure Control and Blood Pressure Response
outcomeMeasures.description: Sitting BP measurements were performed at trough (23-26 hours post-morning dose). Blood pressure control was defined as msSBP/MSDBP \< 140/90 mmHg. Blood pressure response in msSBP was defined as \<140 mmHg or a reduction \>= 20mmHg from baseline. Blood pressure response in msDBP was defined as \< 90 mmHg or a reduction \>= 10 mmHg from baseline.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Only participants of the full analysuis set (FAS), who had week 8 measurements, were included in the analysis. The FAS included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of double-blind study medication.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety.
